meanings.definition: The quality or state of being believable.
meanings.sent1: Her believabilities made her a trustworthy friend.
meanings.sent2: The believabilities of the story were questioned by many.
meanings.sent3: His believabilities were so strong, he could convince anyone of anything!
meanings.sent4: The believabilities of the conspiracy theory were as thin as a spider's web.
meanings.sent5: The believabilities of the magic trick left the audience in awe.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something is capable of being believed.
meanings.sent1: The believabilities of the witness's testimony were crucial in the trial.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are constantly testing the believabilities of different theories.
meanings.sent3: The believabilities of the excuse were so outrageous, it was hard not to laugh.
meanings.sent4: The believabilities of the rumor spread like wildfire through the town.
meanings.sent5: The believabilities of the legend grew with each retelling.
